item.title: Hackers target Iran’s central bank website amid protests
item.description: Internet blackout reported on September 21

item.title: CBDCs require increase in cyber security budget – BIS survey
item.description: Central bankers deem financial sector underprepared for cyber attacks

item.title: Privacy commissioner closes probe into RBNZ cyber defences
item.description: Central bank has “made every change recommended and more” in wake of hacker breach

item.title: Filipe Dinis on Bank of Canada’s cyber strategy and tackling cyber risks
item.description: The Canadian central bank’s chief operating officer calls for heightened vigilance, more collaboration, info sharing and tabletop exercises, and less reliance on similar, siloed systems

item.title: Every CBDC decision is a tradeoff, says Bank of Canada’s Shah
item.description: Privacy, security, and offline access present difficult problems

item.title: ESRB calls for European cyber incident framework
item.description: Regulators must have joint response to systemic cyber incidents

item.title: UAE central bank announces new cyber security centre
item.description: Gulf state saw huge increase in cyber attacks in 2020

item.title: RBNZ served ‘compliance notice’ after cyber attack
item.description: Privacy commissioner concerned by possible “systemic weakness” in central bank’s cyber defences

item.title: Viruses of a different kind: bolstering central bank IT frameworks
item.description: Remote working on a large scale had never been done before, but central banks appear to have successfully adapted IT and cyber frameworks

item.title: Bundesbank warns about digital challenges for German banks
item.description: Report stresses the importance of reinforcing cyber security processes

item.title: Swiss central bank and stock exchange to launch new network
item.description: Communications system based on Scion technology aims to increase cyber security

item.title: Danish central bank denies suffering breach in SolarWinds hack
item.description: Media reports claimed central bank had been exposed for seven months

item.title: RBA cancels market operations due to outage
item.description: Issue at third-party provider impacted central bank and several commercial banks

item.title: RBNZ’s Orr admits ‘shortfalls’ on cyber security
item.description: But KPMG report also lays blame on vendor for delays in pushing out critical software update

item.title: Swedish and Norwegian central banks warn of cyber threats
item.description: Even small attacks can have major effects on stability, Norges Bank and Sveriges Riksbank say

item.title: Over 4,000 FCA staff complete mandatory cyber training
item.description: FCA spends $26,990 on cyber security course

item.title: Most central banks spend less than 20% of their IT budget on security
item.description: Average spend was 16% of IT budget

item.title: Most central banks hold annual cyber security training sessions
item.description: One-third of central banks hold training every 0–6 months

item.title: Cyber security and retaining top talent are biggest tech challenges
item.description: Keeping abreast of fintech developments also tests institutions

item.title: Central banks use varied cyber defence playbook
item.description: Cyber security training for central bank staff occurs at least once a year

item.title: Cyber attacks on finance increased sharply during pandemic – BIS
item.description: Increased use of cloud could increase firms’ vulnerability, researchers warn

item.title: Earlier disclosure by third party could have prevented data breach – Orr
item.description: RBNZ could have avoided breach if patch had been deployed sooner, governor says

item.title: MAS enhances cyber risk guidelines as risks grow
item.description: Authority warns “spate” of cyber attacks have targeted suppliers of IT services

item.title: RBNZ announces independent inquiry into data breach
item.description: Governor takes personal responsibility and says NZ financial system remains sound

item.title: RBNZ suffers data breach in third-party system
item.description: Governor says breach is “contained” and investigations are ongoing

item.title: Bailey urges co-operation on cyber risk
item.description: BoE governor says cyber risks can “go the distance”

item.title: MAS warns firms over third-party cyber risks
item.description: Ravi Menon warns of risks from open source software and third-party service providers

item.title: RBNZ warns of cyber risk from cloud
item.description: Draft guidelines would mandate firms to notify RBNZ over outsourcing critical functions to cloud

item.title: Belize’s central bank must improve cyber regulation – IMF staff
item.description: IMF staff warns central bank must upgrade physical resilience in face of hurricane threat

item.title: Covid-19: a hacker’s opportunity
item.description: What can central banks do to plug cyber threat weaknesses?

item.title: Covid-19 frazzles AI fraud systems
item.description: Seismic changes in customer behaviour see machine learning solutions throw out false positives

item.title: New body will share EU intelligence on cyber-threats
item.description: ECB, Europol and the EU Agency for Cybersecurity join forum to share cyber security information

item.title: Cyber risks cost 2-3% of profits at banks and insurers – RBNZ research
item.description: New Zealand central bank finds chance these threats may cause much greater losses

item.title: IMF-MAS research says cyber risks can be modelled with limited data
item.description: Public data can be used to create unique formulae to model hypothetical cyber attacks

item.title: Cyber security suffers from inconsistent approaches, says IMF’s Lipton
item.description: Emerging markets struggle to implement international recommendations, expert adds

item.title: Riksbank to join ECB’s cyber security framework
item.description: Swedish central bank launches forum with main national financial firms to test Tiber-SE

item.title: Cyber stress tests reveal risks in Singaporean firms
item.description: Insurance firms report potential losses as high as $3.4 billion, while banks’ costs could hit 65% of quarterly profits

item.title: FSI paper details ‘red team testing’
item.description: Paper sets out how the cyber-security tests are used in different jurisdictions

item.title: Cyber attacks on financial firms rise by 37% – survey
item.description: Eighty-eight per cent of participants report domain name system attacks over the last year

item.title: BoE finds room for improvement in cyber attack exercise
item.description: Participants have made changes since previous exercise but some issues remain, central bank says

item.title: MAS issues ‘cyber hygiene’ rules; eases sandbox barriers
item.description: Regulator aims to prevent cyber crime through basic measures while offering some fintechs access to its sandbox within 21 days

item.title: BoE’s Kashyap warns banks vulnerable to state-sponsored cyber attacks
item.description: FPC member says he is not sure banks are capable of defending themselves

item.title: UK and Singapore to collaborate on cyber security
item.description: BoE, FCA and MAS say they will investigate ways to share information and potentially staff

item.title: Bank of Israel to collaborate with national body on cyber defence
item.description: Memorandum with National Cyber Directorate sets stage for closer co-operation on bank security

item.title: FSB working on cyber incident response toolkit
item.description: Team developing tools for effective response and recovery after a cyber attack

item.title: Cyber crime is ‘present danger’ for financial system – BoE deputy
item.description: Sam Woods emphasises need for more widespread stress-testing of cyber security

item.title: Cyber fraudsters starting to rethink tactics – report
item.description: Swift research shows hackers have switched to transferring smaller amounts during normal business hours

item.title: Cyber resilience hinges on collaboration, Nordic central bankers say
item.description: A decline in cash usage means Nordic economies cannot rely on it as a backstop when systems fail; preventative measures must be cost effective, says Norwegian deputy

item.title: FCA survey reveals significant increase in tech failures
item.description: Cyber incidents represented 18% of incidents reported to the FCA in year to October, despite firms appearing confident with current systems and processes

item.title: Report highlights cyber vulnerabilities in securities market
item.description: Structure of the market and number of participants makes sector increasingly difficult to safeguard
